alert.note: Alert for Burnet; Williamson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 5:52PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Williamson and northeastern Burnet Counties through 630 PM CDT... At 552 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bertram to near Andice to near Bartlett. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Georgetown, Burnet, Granger, Bertram, Serenada, Bartlett, Liberty Hill, Jarrell, Florence, Weir, Georgetown Dam, Watson, Granger Dam, Lake Victor, Joppa, Andice, Shady Grove, Oatmeal, Briggs and Sun City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for south central Texas.
